intro: Lepidium densiflorum, commonly known as denseflowered peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often covered in fine hairs. Lepidium densiflorum is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
